did.head: Collection Overview
did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Contains eighteen photographs of Carol Plantamura with musicians associated with her time in Buffalo, including John Bergamo, Karl Kraber, Gregory Ketchum, Robert Dick, Yvar Mikhashoff, Buell Neidlinger, David Fuller, and Jeremy Noble.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Carol Plantamura Collection of Photographs, 1964-1986, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carol Plantamura was born in Los Angeles 8 February 1941. She earned her undergaruate degree from Occidental College and a master's degree from University at Buffalo. She moved to Buffalo in 1964 to join the first class of Creative Associates in the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts. She moved to Rome, Italy in 1966 where she was a member of Musica Elettronica Viva, an electronic music and improvisational ensemble. In 1971 Plantamura was a founding member of the Five Centuries Ensemble, along with John Patrick Thomas, Marijke Verberne, and William Christie. The ensemble toured widley and made six recordings of 17th century music for the Fonit Cetra/Italia recording label.

Plantamura joined the music faculty at the University of California, San Diego in 1978, and is currently an emeritus faculty member. She is also the author of a children's book, Woman Composer, as well as The Opera Lover's Guide to Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains eighteen photographs of Carol Plantamura with musicians associated with her time in Buffalo, including John Bergamo, Karl Kraber, Gregory Ketchum, Robert Dick, Yvar Mikhashoff, Buell Neidlinger, David Fuller, and Jeremy Noble.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is chiefly arranged in chronological order.
